records.location_details: Near Lesvos Island, Greece, in Greek territorial waters, close to a rocky shore, approximately 100 meters to 1 kilometer from land. Migrants were later found drifting in Turkish territorial waters.
records.location_text_raw: near Lesvos on the morning of 13 November 2023
records.country_or_area: Lesvos Island, Greece / Turkish territorial waters
records.uncertainty_note: Exact coordinates not provided, distances to shore are estimates.

possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 1 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 2 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of torture and inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 4 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 19 (1) of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
Article 17 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: NGO reported Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) immobilized a rubber boat with 23 migrants near Lesvos, allegedly destroying its engine with an iron tip and injuring some. Migrants were later rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) in Turkish waters. The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) concluded a likely collective expulsion by HCG, and possible violence and theft. Greek authorities denied involvement and failed to report the incident.
records.evidence_quote: the Office considers established that the group of migrants moved from Greek to Turkish territory and further, finds likely that this occurred as consequence of a collective expulsion executed by the Hellenic Coast Guard.
